segments.text: Hi folks, I'd like to quickly talk about Machete.
I'm sorry and disappointed to say this.
I didn't like it. I couldn't get into it.
I actually knew what I was getting myself into.
I know it's not meant to be taken seriously.
Maybe 70s exploitation movies are more cheesy than Machete
and maybe Planet Terror. I'm not sure. I'm just guessing.
The action and humor were mostly flat.
I can't explain why the humor was multi-flat
because a few or several jokes actually felt funny,
but I just didn't laugh.
It probably would have helped if I went with someone,
if at least one other person went with me.
But whatever, I'm just guessing again.
Maybe only five jokes made me laugh.
It's clear to me that Steven Seagal's death was supposed to be darkly funny
and although I like dark humor, but I just couldn't find it funny.
Was it silly in a good way?
I guess so. It wasn't annoying. It was just there. I wasn't amused.
I knew obviously the movie would be gory maybe a lot more than The Expendables,
but I feel that the movie wasn't really concerned with being exciting.
The action feels that it's pretty much just a quick cut or slash,
blood-screen, you know, flat shit.
Still, the church shootout, however brief that was, it was alright.
Maybe it could have been 20 seconds longer.
The final shootout would actually look good. It was alright.
There was effort. It actually felt fun.
More than just cut and slash and whatever.
I knew the sword fight was short, but I thought it would be decent.
But no, it was bad. It probably wouldn't have helped if it were maybe 30 seconds longer.
The sword fight just feels several slashes, sword crosses,
several quick cuts, and one huge stab. That's it.
It's nearly as bad as the so-called knife fight in Under Siege.
It's probably worth mentioning. I didn't like Under Siege at first.
It's a good movie now, but not... it's always bad.
Tom Lee's performance was awesome in that movie.
Anyway, it's nice that a lot of people like Machete,
and I wouldn't be surprised if there will be a sequel.
But no matter how good the trailer will look,
I will never watch it because the damn trailer for Machete made the movie look so good.
Not as good as The Expendables, but it doesn't have to.
I'm disappointed with Machete. It's unlikely. I'll try it again.
Machete is a huge failure for me.
I probably should have just waited for the damn DVD.
It's probably worth mentioning that Machete has two nice plot twists or turns.
Well, Machete's not for me anyway.
Thank you for listening, and please comment and subscribe if you want to,
but I'm more into comments. Thank you for listening.
